value.title: Allow users to Show and Hide columns in a Power BI Paginated report!
value.excerpt: In a Power BI Paginated Report, you can allow your report consumers to customize what they see in the report such as which columns they want in their table or matrix. Patrick shows you how!  Sample RDLs: https://github.com/guyinacube/demo-files/blob/master/video%20demos/RDL/20230118%20-%20Paginated%20Show%20Hide%20Columns.zip

value.title: Are you thinking about your tooltips in Power BI?
value.excerpt: The base tooltips in Power BI are fine. But are you overusing them? Adding everything to them in your visuals? Adam gives you some things to think about with your tooltips!  Create tooltips based on report pages https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/desktop-tooltips?tabs=powerbi-desktop

value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to visualize graph data? No, not Microsoft Graph. Graph Networks! Adam shows you how you can do this in Power BI Desktop.  Download sample: http://guyinacu.be/graphdatasample  Microsoft Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/graph/overview  Graphs and Networks https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/graph-and-network-algorithms.html

value.title: What are Power BI data connectors and why should you care?
value.excerpt: You need a connector to work with data in Power Query for Power BI or Excel. But what is a connector? Adam explains what these are and how to find out what's available.  Power Query Connectors: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-query/connectors/  Power BI data sources: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/power-bi-data-sources
